The text is mainly talking about ………
questionsData.article: Coffee trees are native to eastern Africa and areas of Arabian Peninsula. Coffee was first grown and traded in the 15th century. Back then, most coffee came from Yemen. Before long, coffee was in high demand all over the Middle East. By the seventeenth century, coffee had been introduced to Europe. European traders (started 1) bringing coffee plants to other parts of the world. By the 20th century, most of the world's production came from Central and South America. Today, Brazil is the largest producer of coffee in the world. Coffee trees can (grow 2) up to nine meters high, but they cut short for production. These trees have shiny dark green leaves that grow on opposite sides of each other on a stem. The plant produces a fruit that is called a coffee cherry. When the coffee cherries are ripe and ready to be picked, (they 3) are red and firm. Inside the fruits are green coffee beans. After these beans are roasted at high temperature, they are ready to be made into a drink.
